lead_paragraph: Jaroslav Spacek agreed yesterday to a three-year contract worth about $10 million with the Buffalo Sabres, a team looking to bolster its depleted defensive ranks. A seven-year N.H.L. veteran, Spacek helped the Edmonton Oilers reach the Stanley Cup finals last month. He is considered a strong puck-handler, fitting the mold for defensemen in the new offense-friendly N.H.L.
